snippet: With an ordinance passed on Tuesday, San Diego became the largest American city to make a legally binding commitment to transition to 100 percent renewable energy.
abstract: San Diego City Council, in binding measure, commits to transition to renewable energy by 2035, in addition to cutting its greenhouse gas emissions by half; eighth-largest city in United States, San Diego is first American municipality to make such a legally enforceable pledge.
lead_paragraph: With an ordinance passed on Tuesday, San Diego became the largest American city to make a legally binding commitment to transition to 100 percent renewable energy.

headline.main: San Diego Vows to Move Entirely to Renewable Energy in 20 Years
headline.print_headline: San Diego, in Binding Measure, Vows to Move to Renewable Energy in 20 Years
